chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy J. Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: plus 10% restitution surcharge. Amount TBD within 60 days.

No contact with J.A., her residence, or her family.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without the agent's approval.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal substances/street drugs/non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry in compliance with Wis. Stat. 301.45 (5) (b) lm.
Complete Sex Offender Assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

supervisions.notes:
**12/20/2016 Amended to add Witness Fees**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
